column4: my sys grub.conf file is not found.. so its in grub rescue mode.. when I try to live boot it says bootloader -> /caspeb/initrd.lz n its unable to boot
please help me to repair my ubuntu install
my sys grub.conf file is not found.. so its in grub rescue mode.. when I try to live boot it says bootloader -> /caspeb/initrd.lz n its unable to boot
follow the directions after "2).Using Ubuntu 9.10 livecd" here: http://ubuntuguide.net/how-to-restore-grub-2-after-reinstalling-windows-xpvistawin7
booting to it doesn't work? sounds like you might have a bad disc. try burning another or use unetbootin to put ubuntu on a usb flashdrive
do you get the same or similar messages when you try to boot them?
: never.. I had these kinda messages
to fix grub you need to get into a live environment of some kind. ideally ubuntu karmic
unetbootin creates liveusbs
k
http://linuxers.org/howto/how-recover-grub2-ubuntu-910-karmic-koala
Hi.. problem solved.. had 2 X 2 GB ram.. removed 1 slot..  now its working...  :)
whaaaaat. that is so wacky. how did you figure it out?
trial n error. :P
tat RAM slot had the problem...
ehh sure it's the slot? not the stick? you could try swapping the ram
ah alright. does it work in another slot?
yeah
yeah something about that just made it corrupt stuff. eh well. strange that it cropped up now. you may have a dying mobo, capacitors going out or something. be sure to backup your data ;)
yeah.. I think it has happened coz of using multiple virtual box, dynampis n other apps tat took a huge load on its memory...
the lappy used to heat up like a volcano.!
